intro: Phalacrachena inuloides, commonly known as the yellow star lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, giving it a star-like appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun. Phalacrachena inuloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
